byline.original: By CARA BUCKLEY and RACHEL DONADIO
byline.contributor: Cara Buckley reported from New York, and Rachel Donadio from Rome. Reporting was contributed by Jack Ewing from Frankfurt; Nicholas Kulish from Berlin; Joseph Goldstein, Elizabeth A. Harris, Colin Moynihan and Christopher Maag from New York; Catherine Garcia from Los Angeles; Raphael Minder from Madrid; Ron Nixon from Washington; and Ravi Somaiya from London.

abstract: Wave of protests sweeps across Asia, the Americas and Europe, buoyed in part by longevity of Occupy Wall Street movement, with hundreds and in some cases thousands of people expressing discontent with economy in marches, rallies and occasional clashes with police.
snippet: Hundreds and in some cases thousands of people voiced discontent with the economy. In New York, at least 88 people were arrested.

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

lead_paragraph: Hundreds and in some cases thousands of people voiced discontent with the economy. In New York, at least 88 people were arrested.

headline.main: Buoyed by Wall St. Protests, Rallies Sweep the Globe
headline.print_headline: Rallies Across the Globe Protest Economic Policies
headline.seo: Around the World, Protests Against Economic Policies
